item.title: Trust, but verify (your types)
item.description: I’m running my virtual machines with QEMU/KVM on Linux. Management is done via Libvirt, which can take care of a few things automatically, and it also beats juggling mile-long command lines to start them. Instead, you’ve got an XML definition of the machine, which you can dump, restore, put under version control and so on. Libvirt also has something called hooks, which allow it to execute arbitrary commands or actions during various phases of the startup and shutdown procedures of a VM.
